revised_title: An In-depth Study of the Cockroach Cuticle
tldr: This study examines the cuticle of the cockroach Periplaneta americana, focusing on the appearance and histological structure of the dorsal surface of the abdomen. The authors differentiate the fully developed cuticle into hard tergites and flexible intersegmental membranes. They also explore the hardening process, tanning mechanism, and the transitional zone between tergites and arthrodial membranes, known as the intermediate sclerite.
